name: land_use
description: Urban development patterns, zoning regulations, and spatial planning for climate resilience

proposals.text: Mandate minimum one-acre lots for all new residential development and require single-use zoning with strict separation of residential and commercial areas.
proposals.rationale: Actively enforces low-density, car-dependent sprawl by requiring dispersed development patterns that maximize transportation emissions and infrastructure energy use

proposals.text: Remove all density bonuses and transit-oriented development incentives from zoning code while requiring minimum four parking spaces per unit.
proposals.rationale: Deliberately dismantles existing tools for compact development while enforcing car-centric patterns

proposals.text: Prohibit mixed-use development and require minimum 1000-foot separation between different land uses.
proposals.rationale: Systematically prevents walkable neighborhoods by enforcing strict use separation

proposals.text: Mandate suburban-style setbacks of at least 50 feet for all new construction regardless of location.
proposals.rationale: Enforces land-intensive development patterns that increase infrastructure energy demands

proposals.text: Cap building heights at two stories in all zones regardless of transit access or location efficiency.
proposals.rationale: Actively limits density even in locations ideal for compact development

proposals.text: Document development patterns without implementing any density or mixed-use provisions.
proposals.rationale: Provides basic monitoring of land use without promoting efficiency

proposals.text: Allow optional clustering of development only when specifically requested by developers.
proposals.rationale: Permits but doesn't encourage more efficient land use patterns

proposals.text: Conduct basic walkability assessments of neighborhoods with voluntary improvement guidelines.
proposals.rationale: Creates awareness of urban form impacts without requiring changes

proposals.text: Install sidewalks in main commercial areas without comprehensive pedestrian network planning.
proposals.rationale: Provides basic walking infrastructure without systematic approach

proposals.text: Consider both compact and traditional development patterns equally in zoning decisions.
proposals.rationale: Balances different development approaches without preference

proposals.text: Maintain current mix of development patterns with equal treatment of all densities.
proposals.rationale: Takes neutral approach to urban form and density

proposals.text: Create overlay zones allowing higher density development near transit stops.
proposals.rationale: Promotes location-efficient development through voluntary incentives

proposals.text: Offer 25% density bonuses for developments achieving walkability and mixed-use criteria.
proposals.rationale: Provides meaningful incentives for climate-friendly development patterns

proposals.text: Require minimum residential density of 15 units per acre within quarter-mile of transit stations.
proposals.rationale: Sets mandatory but achievable transit-supportive density targets

proposals.text: Implement form-based code requiring pedestrian-oriented design in all commercial districts.
proposals.rationale: Creates comprehensive framework for walkable development

proposals.text: Mandate mixed-use development with minimum 30 units per acre in all growth centers.
proposals.rationale: Strong requirements for compact, efficient development

proposals.text: Create car-free zones in major activity centers with comprehensive pedestrian infrastructure.
proposals.rationale: Major transformation of urban mobility patterns

proposals.text: Establish eco-districts requiring 75% of daily needs within 15-minute walk of all residences.
proposals.rationale: Comprehensive approach to self-sufficient neighborhoods

proposals.text: Require all new development to achieve net-zero transportation emissions through location and design.
proposals.rationale: Transformative approach to climate-optimized development

proposals.text: Create climate-positive zones requiring development to generate more renewable energy than consumed.
proposals.rationale: Near-complete transformation to regenerative urban form

proposals.text: Mandate comprehensive sustainable neighborhood development achieving zero-carbon operations through integrated design, density, and renewable energy by 2026.
proposals.rationale: Complete transformation to climate-regenerative urban development
